SOFT AND COZY... EXTRA LONG CORD – I can now use it in bed. I HATED the feeling of being leashed to my electrical outlets. 3 DIFFERENT TEMPERATURE SETTINGS (I love the hottest! my wife likes medium.) HEATS UP QUICKLY and EVENLY! ELECTRONICALLY SAFE AND SOUND with the brilliant 2 HOUR SHUTOFF!OK enough said....

author: UnicornShopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021
review_content: Pros:- Gets hot- Long cord- Decent size- Large, easy to find buttonCons:- Gets way too hot at start then by the time it's just right it turns off- Super light weight, won't stay put- Larger would be better- Button doesn't have enough resistance so a fly could change the setting- Light indicator is too bright- Feels cheapI have EDS so I basically live wrapped in various heating pads as I recover from one strain, sprain, sublux, dislocation, and surgery after another. The fabric on one side is soft and equal to the velour side of a beach towel, the other side is a thin flannel-like material. It's not luxurious by any means.In fact, this is so thin and light weight it practically floats on you. For an area that is sensitive to even a sheet lying on it, this is a plus, but for those that like their heat pad to stay where you put it, you're going to have a hard time.This is the thinnest, lightest, and least soft of any heat pad I have ever used.Second, the large button on the controller (which is nice) is so touch sensitive that if I toss my blanket over it this will press the button and command it to go to the next setting. Just keep the blanket apart from the button you say? Well, the indicator light is bright enough to light a corner of a dark room so if you find that bothersome or understand what lights can do to your sleep cycle, then it's going to need to get along with my light blocking blanket.Third, and perhaps most important, the heat is inconsistent. When turning it on to its lowest setting it quickly gets so hot it could burn you but then takes its time to cool down until the scheduled run time (which feels too short) concludes.I do love the long cord, the large button (just wish it had more resistance), that this gets to be hotter than any other heat pad I've ever used, and it's a decent size (but I wish it were a bit bigger).Ultimately, it's just ok, mostly a pain to keep in place and to keep at the level it's set at, it'll burn you before it gets to a comfortable temperature just before it turns off. I need a heat pad right now so I'm keeping, with hopes of finding something better before the return period ends it but my search continues because this just isn't good enough.
